meanings.definition: Lacking in vision or understanding; myopic.
meanings.sent1: His purblindness to the consequences of his actions led to many mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The purblindness of the driver caused him to miss the stop sign.
meanings.sent3: Despite his purblindness in math, he still managed to pass the test.
meanings.sent4: Her purblindness to the dangers of the forest made her an easy target for predators.
meanings.sent5: The purblindness of the team's strategy was evident in their defeat.

meanings.sent1: The old cat's purblindness made it difficult for her to catch mice.
meanings.sent2: His purblindness in the dark alley almost caused him to trip over a stray cat.
meanings.sent3: The purblindness of the bat led to some comical attempts at catching insects.
meanings.sent4: The purblindness of the telescope limited its ability to see distant stars.
meanings.sent5: The purblindness of the owl allowed the mouse to escape unnoticed.

meanings.sent1: Her purblindness in understanding the joke made her the last to laugh.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's purblindness to the student's struggles hindered their progress.
meanings.sent3: His purblindness in grasping new concepts often left him feeling frustrated.
meanings.sent4: The company's purblindness in adapting to market changes led to its downfall.
meanings.sent5: The purblindness of the detective delayed the solving of the case.
